reviews.review_msg: Also took HIST 308 and 317 with him. He is a really good prof if you are willing to pay attention. He is a tough marker but if you go to office hours and go through your essay ideas he will help you a lot. Definitely a tough prof for non-History majors.

He marks hard but if you're interested in a specific topic, talk to him about it and he'll tell you to write a paper about it. In such cases he marks very generously. I found that his accent and enthusiasm adds to the flavour of the course.

Lectures are not clearly defined. He likes to jump back and forth from one time period to another. History department really needs to have someone sit in on one of his class and see how bad he really is.

Anyone who didn't like him or didn't find him helpful is an idiot. Yes he's a bit challenging and Byzantine history isn't for everyone, but if you put in some decent work and interest in the course you'll do fine. I've taken 3 classes with him now and I've done well in each one. And his English is super.

He has a high rate of interest in Byzantium. He was one of the best seminars that I ever took, although the material could be dry he usually found a way to make it more interesting. His marking is fair and if you need help or clarification he is approachable.
